Trump said he did not mind being called a despot as he had been called much worse. Hiester's team, along with others, cancelled their performances out of respect, but he said when he returned to the site after an hour, he saw the crowd enjoying the show and the announcer hosting the show with unabated enthusiasm.

COLA increases Social Security payments for 2026: Boosts confirmed for retirees
description: Social Security beneficiaries will see a 2.8% increase in their monthly payments starting January 2026. This adjustment will benefit over 75 million Americans, including retirees and disabled workers. While welcome, the rise may not fully cover escalating living costs, especially healthcare. Higher earnings limits for those working while receiving benefits are also set for 2026.

title: IND vs SA: Gill likely to reach CoE a week before T20I series; roadmap unclear so far
description: Shubman Gill, India's Test and ODI captain, is currently resting in Mumbai following a roadmap set by medical experts. He is expected to join the BCCI Centre of Excellence around December 1st or 2nd, a week before the T20I series against South Africa begins.  His availability for the T20Is is still uncertain as the team management explores all options.

title: 'Sindh may return to India': Rajnath says 'borders can change'; cites civilisational link
description: Defence minister Rajnath Singh said borders can change and the Sindh region might rejoin India. highlighting country's long civilisational links with the region. Singh referenced L K Advani's views on Sindhi Hindus still not able to accept the separation. He added everyone who considers Indus river pious is our own.

description: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against South Africa due to injuries to regular captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Shreyas Iyer. The squad sees the return of Ravindra Jadeja and the inclusion of Tilak Varma in the middle order, while Jasprit Bumrah has been rested.

title: 'Nothing to say': Kharge on K'taka power tussle; Cong chief says high command will decide
description: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah's tenure is under renewed speculation as the Congress government reaches its halfway mark. Party chief Mallikarjun Kharge stated the high command will decide on any leadership changes, while Siddaramaiah maintains the buzz is media-driven. Friction reportedly exists over a cabinet reshuffle, with supporters of Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar seeking clarity on leadership first.

title: Ahead of key meet over Ukraine ‘peace plan’, Zelenskyy says ‘we must do everything’ against ‘wicked Russian attacks’
Salute & tears: Wing Commander Afshan's emotional goodbye to husband Namansh Syal
description: Wing Commander Namansh Syal died in a Tejas fighter jet crash in Dubai. The aircraft crashed during an aerobatic demonstration. His mortal remains were brought to his native village in Himachal Pradesh. Villagers and family members paid emotional tributes. The Indian Air Force is investigating the cause of the mishap. This is the second Tejas crash since its induction.

title: Will Jalen Hurts play vs Cowboys today? Latest injury update on Eagles quarterback
description: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts is set to play against the Dallas Cowboys today, with no injury concerns. He recently addressed speculation about teammate frustration, emphasizing his commitment to accountability and internal improvement. The highly anticipated game kicks off at 4:25 p.m. ET on FOX.

description: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion of a 72-hour workweek, referencing China's "996" culture, has reignited debate. While China's "996" model powered its tech boom, it led to burnout and was eventually declared illegal due to its detrimental impact on workers' well-being.

description: An Indian national, Jagjit Singh, visiting Canada on a temporary visa, has been convicted of criminally harassing two teenage girls near their school. Singh's actions, including attempting to take photos and putting his arm around a student, led to his arrest and a jail sentence following which he has been ordered to be deported and never to return to Canada.

title: India announce ODI squad for South Africa series: KL Rahul to lead in Shubman Gill’s absence; Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli feature as Jasprit Bumrah is rested
Nicholas Singh arrested: Indian-origin on Canada's 'most wanted' list nabbed after 18 mths
description: A fugitive of Indian origin, Nicholas Singh, has been apprehended in Toronto after an 18-month evasion. Previously on Canada's 'most wanted list,' Singh was serving a lengthy sentence for armed robbery and other offenses.  Authorities discovered him with a firearm, leading to new charges including illegal possession of a regulated weapon.

title: Smriti wedding postponed: Who is Shriniwas Mandhana? Batter's father hospitalised
description: Smriti Mandhana's wedding, scheduled for Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to her father, Shriniwas Mandhana, falling unwell. He was admitted to the hospital and is under observation. Shriniwas, a former district-level cricketer himself, had always supported his children's cricketing aspirations, with Smriti fulfilling his dream of playing for India.

title: Armaan Jain says Kapoor family came together ‘like an army’ during Sunjay Kapur’s death, Saif Ali Khan’s knife attack: ‘Bouncing back is in our DNA’
‘I find this gifts funda very stupid’: Anushka Sharma reveals why she feels uncomfortable receiving gifts
Senuran Muthusamy reacts after scoring century vs India at Guwahati: ‘It was a really special moment in front of this full house’

Anupam Kher stood on a coffee shop table and shouted to demand fair pay for a film: ‘The producer had just made 100 million’
Bengaluru techie duped of Rs 48 lakh by fake Ayurvedic 'Guruji'; suffers kidney damage
description: A 29-year-old software engineer was allegedly defrauded of Rs 48 lakh by a self-proclaimed Ayurvedic healer and a medicine shop. The healer sold him costly herbal products, claiming they would cure his sexual health issues. The victim's health reportedly worsened after consuming the medicines, leading to kidney complications.

title: Netanyahu shares article linking Epstein to Israeli intelligence
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a controversial article from the socialist magazine Jacobin, alleging Jeffrey Epstein claimed to have meddled in Israel's elections and consulted former PM Ehud Barak. The piece, based on leaked texts, raises questions about Epstein's political ties and potential links to Israeli intelligence. Critics argue Netanyahu's action legitimizes anti-Israel narratives from a publication known for such content, potentially harming Israel's global standing.

title: 'Not option, but necessity': PM Modi calls for UNSC reforms at IBSA meet
description: Prime Minister Modi stressed the urgent need to reform the UN Security Council, urging India, Brazil, and South Africa to champion global governance overhauls. He advocated for enhanced security cooperation, including institutionalizing NSA-level dialogues, and proposed an 'IBSA Digital Innovation Alliance' for technology sharing. Discussions also covered climate resilience and South-South cooperation.

title: Palaash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana’s wedding postponed indefinitely after cricketer’s father falls ill
Bengaluru: Auto driver sets himself on fire during police routine check; tension in area
description: A 35-year-old auto driver in Chitradurga attempted self-immolation after alleging persistent harassment by traffic police during a drunk-driving check. He poured petrol on himself and set himself ablaze near Gandhi Circle, reportedly after being manhandled. Onlookers rescued him; he is in serious condition with 50 percent burns.

title: 25 years of Indian Cinema: 2016 was the year of Dangal, Fan, Udta Punjab and Pink
Michael Irvin is navigating a personal moment that has left him openly emotional
description: NFL legend Michael Irvin shared a personal moment of vulnerability, revealing his dog Aurora underwent ACL surgery. He drew parallels to his own past injuries and CeeDee Lamb's current situation, eliciting a wave of support and well wishes from fans. Supporters offered prayers, shared their own pet recovery stories, and expressed optimism for Aurora's healing.

title: Two-day Ashes victory hits Cricket Australia pockets as sizable ticket revenue lost
Moss spores survive months in space: Why is this significant?

Indian students weigh US higher education amid growing uncertainty
What happens to your body when you have momos daily
'Father's condition kept worsening': Smriti Mandhana–Muchhal wedding postponed
description: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding, slated for this Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to the cricketer's father's ill health. The family is requesting privacy during this difficult time. The couple, who made their relationship public in July 2024, had planned an intimate ceremony. Their focus is now on the father's recovery.

McRae and Hughes quietly move from rumor-mill chatter to an online spectacle
description: A fan photo of Tate McRae and Jack Hughes in Manhattan sparked dating rumors, but Lexi Brown's humorous take on McRae's outfit, wearing Hughes' team colors, shifted the narrative. This playful interaction highlights McRae's embrace of hockey culture while Hughes recovers from a hand injury, offering fans an encouraging update on his well-being.

title: Gemini 3 vs Gemini 3 Pro vs Gemini 3 DeepThink: A quick guide to Google’s latest AI models
From Bihar to Bengal: How SIR is reshaping voter rolls; a deep dive into how it works
description: India's voter rolls are undergoing a Special Intensive Revision (SIR), a nationwide exercise to ensure accuracy. While the Election Commission calls it crucial for democracy, political parties allege it's a politically motivated move to alter electoral outcomes, sparking debate and legal challenges. The process aims for clean rolls but faces opposition concerns.

title: Chandigarh under Article 240: No bill this Winter Session; what the change would mean
description: The home ministry clarified that the proposed Constitution (131st Amendment) Bill for Chandigarh will not be introduced in the upcoming Winter Session. The government stated the Bill, aimed at simplifying law-making for the Union Territory, is still under consideration and no final decision has been made.

'Fake news': French navy on Pak media reports on Op Sindoor; calls Rafale claims fabricated
description: The French Navy has debunked Pakistani media claims of a French officer confirming Pakistani air superiority and the downing of Indian Rafale jets. The Navy stated that Captain Yvan Launay never made such comments, clarifying his role was technical and he refused to comment on specific aerial engagements or Chinese systems.

description: A Delhi school student, reportedly distressed and claiming teachers "tortured" him, died by suicide near Rajendra Place Metro Station. He left a note accusing teachers of harassment. The Delhi government has formed an inquiry committee, and the school suspended four staff members amid ongoing protests.

description: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

India’s employability gap: What rising male gains and female fluctuations mean
description: The India Skills Report 2026 reveals a sharp shift in gendered employability trends, with men overtaking women in 2025 before women regained a narrow lead this year. The six-year swing highlights how technical-skill demand, systemic barriers, and divergent regional preferences shape workforce outcomes. The findings raise urgent questions about equity, access, and India’s preparedness for a gender-balanced labour market.

Class 10 student suicide: School counsellor dismissed his suicidal thoughts as a 'joke'
description: Classmates of 16-year-old Shourya Patil claim he told the school counselor about suicidal thoughts weeks before his death, but the concern was dismissed. Patil died by suicide on November 18, with his suicide note detailing sustained humiliation by four teachers who have since been suspended. Protesters are demanding justice.

Nvidia chip smuggling case: US arrests tech firm CTO
description: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.89 million in wire transfers received from China to fund the scheme.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
description: An AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has gone viral, sparking memes and commentary. The "$1 trillion squad" photo perfectly captures the 2025 mood of AI races and billionaire influence, becoming a cultural phenomenon.

title: Turn the love up: Inside the odd bromance of Donald Trump and Zohran Mamdani
Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
description: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: Top cardiologist warns of one morning habit causing heart attacks minutes after waking
description: Cortisol, as we know is the stress hormone, that can raise blood pressure and heart during mental or emotional stress. The cortisol surge lowers heart rate variability. Dr. Heigl, showed data from continuous ECG monitors: in patients with cardiac events, heart rate variability dropped sharply within minutes of waking

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.
